I'm happy to help you with your question! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your personal information, including your flight history or loyalty program details. I'm a new conversation each time you interact with me, so I don't retain any information from previous conversations.

That being said, I can provide general information about United Airlines' loyalty program and upgrade policies. United Airlines' loyalty program is called MileagePlus, and it allows members to earn and redeem miles for flights, upgrades, and other rewards.

To redeem miles for an upgrade on a long-haul flight, you'll typically need to have a certain number of miles in your account, and the availability of upgrade awards will depend on the flight and route. United Airlines has different types of upgrade awards, including:

1. Upgrade awards: These allow you to upgrade from economy to premium cabins (such as Polaris business class or Premium Plus) on eligible flights.
2. Regional upgrade awards: These allow you to upgrade from economy to first class or business class on shorter flights within the United States, Canada, and Latin America.

The number of miles required for an upgrade award varies depending on the route, flight, and travel dates. You can check the United Airlines website or consult with a United Airlines representative to determine the specific requirements for your desired flight.

To give you a better idea, United Airlines typically requires:

* 20,000-30,000 miles for a one-way upgrade from economy to premium economy on a domestic flight
* 30,000-50,000 miles for a one-way upgrade from economy to business class on a domestic flight
* 50,000-70,000 miles for a one-way upgrade from economy to business class on an international flight

Keep in mind that upgrade awards are subject to availability, and it's always best to check with United Airlines for the most up-to-date information and to confirm the requirements for your specific flight.

If you're leaning towards United Airlines for your next trip, I recommend logging into your MileagePlus account to check your current balance and explore the upgrade options available to you. You can also consider contacting United Airlines' customer service to discuss your options and get more personalized advice.
